text: Iran is the anchor of stability in an
otherwise ocean of regional
instabilities the so-called Iranian
threat which has been employed as an
excuse to justify a long catalogue of
crimes and catastrophic practices over
the past three decades unjust sanctions
as manifestation of structural violence
are intrinsically inhumane and against
peace is not the state and the political
elite that are targeted but rather it is
the common people who are victimized by
these sanctions the human tragedy in
Syria represent a painful example of
catastrophic spread of violence and
extremism in our region we emphasize
that there was no military solution to
the Syrian crisis pursuit of
expansionist strategies and objectives
and attempts to change the regional
balance through proxies cannot be
camouflage behind humanitarian rhetoric
Iran and other actors should pursue two
common objectives one Iran's nuclear
program and for the matter that of all
other countries must pursue exclusively
peaceful purposes this has been and will
always be the objective of the Islamic
Republic of Iran the second objective
that is acceptance of and respect for
the implementation of the right to the
enrichment inside Iran and enjoyment of
other related nuclear rights provides
the only path toward achieving the first
objective acceptance of the inalienable
right of Iran constitutes the best and
the easiest way of resolving this issue
in this context the Islamic Republic of
Iran is prepared to engage immediately
in time bound and result-oriented talks
to build mutual confidence
seeks constructive engagement with other
countries based on mutual respect and
common interests and within the same
framework does not seek to increase
tensions with the United States I listen
carefully to the statement made by
President Obama today at the General
Assembly commensurate with the political
will of the leadership in the United
States and hoping that they will refrain
from following the short-sighted
interests of war mongering pressure
groups we can arrive at a framework to
manage our differences the human society
should be elevated from the state of
mere tolerance to that of collective
collaboration
